contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "they bowed their heads in awe" or 2) "they bowed down low in reverence." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
This symbolic gesture accompanies prayer. Alternate translation: "lift up my hands and pray to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: spread my hands out to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This symbolic gesture accompanies prayer. See how you translated a similar phrase in [Exodus 9:29](../09/29.md). Alternate translation: "lifted up his hands toward Yahweh and prayed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: spread out his hands to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: These symbolic acts were the normal way that people showed great respect and devotion in that culture. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
